us.phonetic: /adj. æbˈstrækt, ˈæbstrækt; n. ˈæbstrækt; v. æbˈstrækt/, (adj. ab strakt′, ab′strakt; n. ab′strakt; v. ab strakt′ for 11–14, ab′strakt for 15)

example.eg: The three women in this painting depict the abstract ideas of faith, hope and love.
example.egtrans: 这幅画中的三位女子表现了信仰、希望和爱这些抽象的概念。

example.eg: Thinking about the problem in an abstract way will not solve it; we need to discuss practical solutions.
example.egtrans: 抽象的思考方式并不能解决问题，我们得讨论切实的解决办法。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不切实际的, 没有实际意义的

example.eg: The office is decorated with abstract paintings.
example.egtrans: 这间办公室用抽象派的画作装饰。

example.eg: When I started out in my career, I had a rather abstract idea of what success might look like.
example.egtrans: 事业之初，我并不清楚成功是什么样子的。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不具体的, 不明确的

example.eg: The abstract looked interesting so I downloaded the paper.
example.egtrans: 这篇摘要看起来很有意思，所以我下载了这篇论文。

example.eg: The handout will abstract the main points of the speech.
example.egtrans: 分发的资料中对演讲的要点做了摘要。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 做…的摘录概要, 对…进行摘要, 总结

example.eg: It is difficult to abstract Baroque music from its religious context.
example.egtrans: 巴洛克音乐和其宗教背景密不可分。

us.phonetic: /adj. æbˈstrækt, ˈæbstrækt; n. ˈæbstrækt; v. æbˈstrækt/, (adj. ab strakt′, ab′strakt; n. ab′strakt; v. ab strakt′ for 11–14, ab′strakt for 15)

example.eg: Lately abstracts have not been popular at auctions.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 抽象派作品, 抽象艺术

example.eg: Farmers have rights to abstract well water.
example.egtrans: 农民拥有取井水的权利。

example.eg: The data is abstracted from online news stories.

us.phonetic: /adj. æbˈstrækt, ˈæbstrækt; n. ˈæbstrækt; v. æbˈstrækt/, (adj. ab strakt′, ab′strakt; n. ab′strakt; v. ab strakt′ for 11–14, ab′strakt for 15)

example.eg: When looking at abstract art, remember that it is usually not a portrayal of a tangible object.
Beauty, truth, and honesty are all abstract ideas that you can illustrate with specific instances.
